com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform

Class AbstractSharedDataPlatform<DESC extends ISharedDataDescriptor,DATA extends ISharedData<DESC>,STORAGE extends IDataStorage<DESC,DATA>,QUERY extends IDataQuery<DESC,DATA>,QUERYRESULT extends IQueryResult<DESC,DATA>,CONDITION extends IDataCondition<DESC,DATA,QUERY,QUERYRESULT>,ACTION extends IDataAction<DESC,DATA,STORAGE,QUERYRESULT>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform.AbstractSharedDataPlatform<DESC,DATA,STORAGE,QUERY,QUERYRESULT,CONDITION,ACTION>

      • subscriptionLeaseMsec

        protected static int subscriptionLeaseMsec
        Lease time out. This is made a static field only so that junit tests can modify it. In general, it should be considered a constant, otherwise.

      • SUBSCRIPTION_REFRESH_MSEC_PROPERTY

        public static final java.lang.String SUBSCRIPTION_REFRESH_MSEC_PROPERTY
        If larger than 0 (the default), then create a thread that periodically refreshes the subscriptions. This is generally used if the registry does not provide notification of peer additions/subtractions, for example, the FixedRegistry.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • QUERY_TIMEOUT_PROPERTY

        public static final java.lang.String QUERY_TIMEOUT_PROPERTY
        Defines the timeout in milliseconds that the platform waits for queried platforms to respond.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • addRemoteDataListener

        public java.lang.Object addRemoteDataListener(IPeerSelector apps,
                                     CONDITION condition,
                                     ACTION action)
        Description copied from interface: ISharedDataPlatform
        Install a listener that will receive notifications according to the given specifications of the peers' data, conditions on that data and priority relative to other peers.

        If the condition provided in the handler is null then it is considered to evaluate to true. the handler. If the condition is not null and it is an aggregator (it's isAggregate()) method returns true), then the subscription will wait for the occurence of either a) a fixed amount of time or b) for all the initially identified peers to respond. After either (a) or (b), the condition/action will be called with whatever data is available. After that point, they will be called for each new arrival of data. If the condition is not an aggregator, then the condition/action will be evaluated on every new arrival of data.

        The subscription remains active until it is explicitly canceled with a call to ISharedDataPlatform.removeRemoteDataListener(Object).

        Must be called after the platform is started using ISharedDataPlatform.start().

        Specified by:
        addRemoteDataListener in interface ISharedDataPlatform<DESC extends ISharedDataDescriptor,DATA extends ISharedData<DESC>,STORAGE extends IDataStorage<DESC,DATA>,QUERY extends IDataQuery<DESC,DATA>,QUERYRESULT extends IQueryResult<DESC,DATA>,CONDITION extends IDataCondition<DESC,DATA,QUERY,QUERYRESULT>,ACTION extends IDataAction<DESC,DATA,STORAGE,QUERYRESULT>>
        Parameters:
        apps - specifies a selection of peer applications.
        condition - the condition to be evaluated against the queried data
        action - the action to be taken if the condition evaluates to true.
        Returns:
        null on failure, otherwise an object that is used to later remove the listener

      • addRemoteDataListener

        public java.lang.Object addRemoteDataListener(IPeerSelector apps,
                                     QUERY query,
                                     ACTION action)

        query - if null, then query any data.
        Returns:

      • sendMessage

        public boolean sendMessage(IApplicationDescriptor appDesc,
                  IMessage msg)
                    throws DSMException
        Description copied from interface: ISharedDataPlatform
        Send a message to a specific application peer. The received message is first processed by the platform and if not handled by it, then the peer application will receive it if they have create their own listener via ISharedDataPlatform.addMessageListener(IMessageListener).
        Specified by:
        sendMessage in interface ISharedDataPlatform<DESC extends ISharedDataDescriptor,DATA extends ISharedData<DESC>,STORAGE extends IDataStorage<DESC,DATA>,QUERY extends IDataQuery<DESC,DATA>,QUERYRESULT extends IQueryResult<DESC,DATA>,CONDITION extends IDataCondition<DESC,DATA,QUERY,QUERYRESULT>,ACTION extends IDataAction<DESC,DATA,STORAGE,QUERYRESULT>>
        Returns:
        true if the message was put on the wire, but since we operate in a distributed environment, the message may not actually get delivered.
        Throws:
        DSMException

      • stopSusbcriptionMaintenanceThread

        protected void stopSusbcriptionMaintenanceThread()
        This is provided primarily for using during debugging when a fixed registry is being used. It is helpful in this case to be able to turn off the resubscriptions after the apps have all started so that debug messages from message sending do not get in the way of other debug messages.

      • getTopologicalRelationships

        public java.util.Collection<TopologyRelationship> getTopologicalRelationships(IApplicationDescriptor peer)
        Description copied from interface: ISharedDataPlatform
        Get the topological relationships of the given peer to this platform instance. If the given peer is not reachable, then no relationships will be determined. If it is reachable, then the collection will contain TopologyRelationship.Reachable but may contain others (neighbor, parent, etc).
        Specified by:
        getTopologicalRelationships in interface ISharedDataPlatform<DESC extends ISharedDataDescriptor,DATA extends ISharedData<DESC>,STORAGE extends IDataStorage<DESC,DATA>,QUERY extends IDataQuery<DESC,DATA>,QUERYRESULT extends IQueryResult<DESC,DATA>,CONDITION extends IDataCondition<DESC,DATA,QUERY,QUERYRESULT>,ACTION extends IDataAction<DESC,DATA,STORAGE,QUERYRESULT>>
        Returns:
        never null, but perhaps empty if there is not connectivity to the given peer.

      • queryRemoteData

        public java.util.List<QUERYRESULT> queryRemoteData(IPeerSelector apps,
                                          QUERY query)
        Description copied from interface: ISharedDataPlatform
        Query data from each peer specified. Queries use a timeout defined by ISharedDataPlatform.setQueryTimeout(long).
        Specified by:
        queryRemoteData in interface ISharedDataPlatform<DESC extends ISharedDataDescriptor,DATA extends ISharedData<DESC>,STORAGE extends IDataStorage<DESC,DATA>,QUERY extends IDataQuery<DESC,DATA>,QUERYRESULT extends IQueryResult<DESC,DATA>,CONDITION extends IDataCondition<DESC,DATA,QUERY,QUERYRESULT>,ACTION extends IDataAction<DESC,DATA,STORAGE,QUERYRESULT>>
        query - may be null, in which case all data is returned for each peer.
        Returns:
        never null. A list of query results from peers who responded within the timeout.

      • setUserQueryData

        public void setUserQueryData(java.lang.Object userQueryData)
        Description copied from interface: ISharedDataPlatform
        Provided to allow application-specific data to be passed to IApplicationDataQuery methods applied to local data. Initially this includes the following, but may include others
        • IDataQuery.query(ISharedDataPlatform, Object)
        • IDataQuery.isQueryMatch(ISharedData, ISharedDataPlatform, Object)
        The given object will be passed to all queries (subscribed or one-shot) that this instance makes.

      • isSatisfied

        public java.util.List<IApplicationDescriptor> isSatisfied(IPeerSelector apps,
                                                 CONDITION condition)
                                                   throws DSMException
        Description copied from interface: ISharedDataPlatform
        Query data from each peer specified to see if the condition holds on them. This is roughly equivalent to calling ISharedDataPlatform.queryRemoteData(TopologyRelationship, IDataQuery), where the query is taken from condition.getQuery(), followed by IDataCondition.isSatisfied(List, List) where the first parameter is the results of the query applied locally and the 2nd is the results of the remote query.

        If the conditions is

        • pair-wise : the condition is evaluated for each peer that responds with data for the query. The returned list includes those sources that provided data that satisfies the condition.
        • aggregate : the condition is evaluated once with all responding peers' data provided to the condition. If the condition is satisfied, the return listed contains all sources of those data.
        Specified by:
        isSatisfied in interface ISharedDataPlatform<DESC extends ISharedDataDescriptor,DATA extends ISharedData<DESC>,STORAGE extends IDataStorage<DESC,DATA>,QUERY extends IDataQuery<DESC,DATA>,QUERYRESULT extends IQueryResult<DESC,DATA>,CONDITION extends IDataCondition<DESC,DATA,QUERY,QUERYRESULT>,ACTION extends IDataAction<DESC,DATA,STORAGE,QUERYRESULT>>
        Returns:
        never null. A list of peers whose results satisfied the condition. An empty list if the condition was not satisfied.
        Throws:
        DSMException

      • isSatisfied

                                                 CONDITION condition)
                                                   throws DSMException
